metadata.description: Comprehensive 15-template civil collection (5 earthworks + 5 drainage + 5 retaining walls) with measurement assumptions, derivation formulas, and Australian industry productivity standards

templates.name: Bulk Earthwork - Cut (Clay)
templates.description: Bulk excavation in clay, 1000m³ base volume, benched batter slopes, off-site disposal

soil_conditions.soil_classification: Moderate to heavy, stable when benched, standard excavation
soil_conditions.bulking_rationale: Excavated clay material expands 25% when loose (displacement in truck/spoil heap)

excavation_methodology.spoil_management: Continuous haul to approved waste facility

excavation_volume_cut.soil_type_note: Clay factor 1.0 (baseline) - standard excavation rate 15-20 m³/hr
excavation_volume_cut.notes: Cut material excavated in-place; no waste factor applied (measured from site)

spoil_disposal_volume.formula: Excavation volume × bulking factor (loose material displacement)
spoil_disposal_volume.notes: Conservative bulking for clay; 5% additional waste for compaction dust loss and operational spillage

excavation.gang_composition: 1 excavator operator + 1 truck driver (2-3 trucks rotating)
equipment_list: 6-8m³ tipper trucks (2-3 units for continuous haul)
excavation.notes: Assumes standard site conditions, truck turnaround time ~30 min each, continuous operation

disposal_management.notes: Disposal labour includes spotting trucks, compaction supervision, environmental monitoring

soil_type_factors.notes: Applied to excavation productivity rate (m³/hour) - example: Rock = 15 m³/hr ÷ 2.5 = 6 m³/hr

depth_factors.notes: Deeper cuts require shoring, slope angle flattening, increased safety protocols. Applied to labour rate.

access_and_site.notes: Affects truck access and equipment mobility

templates.name: Bulk Earthwork - Fill (Select)
templates.description: Bulk fill placement with select material, 1000m³ base volume, 95% compaction modified, layered placement

material_properties.fill_type: Select fill (imported clean fill, free of contamination)
material_properties.compaction_note: Tighter than standard earthfill (90%), suitable for structural fills under buildings
material_properties.interpretation: 1m³ compacted fill requires 0.9m³ of loose source material (10% reduction through compaction)

placement_methodology.layer_thickness_note: 250mm compacted layer depth - tested each layer for density compliance
placement_methodology.watering: Pre-wet material for optimal compaction response
placement_methodology.testing_frequency: Density test every 500m³ via sand cone or nuclear gauge

fill_volume_compacted.notes: Measurement taken after compaction settlement; no waste applied (specification-driven)

source_material_required.formula: Compacted volume ÷ bulking factor (reverse: accounts for shrinkage via compaction)
source_material_required.notes: 5% waste covers: stockpile management losses, segregation waste (removing unsuitable material), moisture adjustment overages

compaction.gang_composition: 1 roller operator + 1 bulldozer driver + 1 site supervisor + 1 tester
compaction.compaction_methodology: Layer-by-layer: spread 250mm → pre-wet → roller pass (min 4 passes) → density test
compaction.notes: Productivity assumes: material delivered on-site, layers properly spread, optimal moisture content

testing_and_inspection.testing_method: Sand cone (AS 1289.5.3.1) or nuclear density gauge
testing_and_inspection.notes: Testing costs ~AUD $300-500 per test; included in labour allowance

compaction_standard_factor.notes: Higher standard = more passes, tighter control → slower productivity

layer_thickness_factor.notes: Thinner layers = more number of lifts, more time; thicker = fewer passes but less control

templates.name: Site Preparation - Small
templates.description: Site preparation for 1 hectare, 300mm topsoil strip, stockpile on-site, clearing and grubbing

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Area-based with depth (m² × strip depth in m³)

site_clearance.grubbing_note: Root removal to 150mm below surface; allows topsoil to be removed cleanly
site_clearance.asbestos_screening: Assumed clear (not included in template; specialist scope if required)

topsoil_stripping.stripping_method: Blade scrape with wheel loader or grader
topsoil_stripping.interpretation: Topsoil expands ~15% when stockpiled loose (aeration, moisture loss)

topsoil_volume_stripped.notes: In-place volume measurement; no waste applied

topsoil_volume_stockpiled.formula: Stripped volume × bulking factor (aeration in stockpile)
topsoil_volume_stockpiled.notes: 5% waste accounts for: contamination screening losses, weather runoff from pile, segregation

vegetation_clearing.formula: Site area (as area metric for clearing operations)
vegetation_clearing.notes: Clearing productivity typically 2,000-3,000 m²/day for moderate vegetation

topsoil_stripping.gang_composition: 1 wheel loader operator + 1 truck driver (1-2 trucks for haul if off-site)
equipment_list: Grader or blade scraper for levelling
topsoil_stripping.notes: Assumes continuous operation, suitable topsoil, standard moisture content

vegetation_clearing.notes: Productivity varies with vegetation density: light = 600 m²/hr, moderate = 400 m²/hr, heavy = 200 m²/hr

soil_type_factor.notes: Applied to stripping rate; wet clay slows blade movement

templates.name: Site Preparation - Large
templates.description: Site preparation for 5 hectares, 300mm topsoil strip, off-site disposal, clearing and grubbing

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Area-based with depth (m² × strip depth in m³)

topsoil_stripping.stripping_method: Blade scrape with large wheel loader or grader
topsoil_stripping.disposal_method: Off-site to licensed waste facility or landscaping contractor
topsoil_stripping.volume_economy: Larger projects = higher productivity due to fewer mobilization delays

topsoil_volume_for_disposal.formula: Stripped volume × bulking factor × waste factor
topsoil_volume_for_disposal.notes: Large projects benefit from bulk disposal pricing; calculate based on waste allowance

topsoil_stripping.gang_composition: 1 grader/loader operator + 2 truck drivers (3-4 trucks for continuous haul)
equipment_list: Motor grader or large wheel loader (3.5+ m³ bucket)
Tipper trucks (8-10m³ capacity, 3-4 units for efficiency)
topsoil_stripping.economy_of_scale: Larger volume = better productivity due to longer continuous runs, truck queue management
topsoil_stripping.notes: 5ha sites typically run 2-3 weeks; continuous equipment operation

equipment_list: Tipper trucks for mulch haul (if off-site)
vegetation_clearing.notes: Larger scale allows dedicated equipment; faster per-area productivity

project_scale_factor.notes: Larger projects allow continuous workflow; reduced mobilization overhead per unit

templates.name: Excavation - Rock
templates.description: Rock excavation 500m³ base volume, rock breaker and controlled blasting methods, off-site disposal

rock_conditions.interpretation: Rock excavation 2.5x harder than clay; requires breaker or blasting vs. bucket
rock_conditions.bulking_rationale: Fractured rock expands 60% after blasting (loose fragments have high void ratio)

excavation_methodology.blasting: Controlled blasting (licensed blasting contractor) - Austroads 2m buffer minimum
excavation_methodology.primary_equipment: Hydraulic rock breaker (60-90 tonne attachment) mounted on excavator
excavation_methodology.backup_method: If blasting restricted: Rock breaker only (slower, safer in urban sites)
excavation_methodology.disposal_method: Off-site to licensed quarry or aggregate processing facility

rock_volume_excavated.notes: In-place solid volume; no waste applied

spoil_volume_loose.formula: Excavation volume × bulking factor (fragmentation void space)
spoil_volume_loose.notes: 5% waste covers: fines generation during blasting/breaking, compaction dust, segregation losses

rock_excavation.gang_composition: 1 excavator operator + 1 blasting supervisor (if blasting) + 2 truck drivers (4-5 trucks)
equipment_list: 50-70 tonne excavator with 60-90 tonne rock breaker attachment
rock_excavation.blasting_protocol: Licensed blasting contractor (additional cost ~AUD $5,000-10,000 per shot), 8am-4pm windows only
rock_excavation.rock_breaker_alternative: If blasting unavailable (urban, restricted hours), rock breaker only = 3-5 m³/hr

disposal_management.notes: Rock disposal to quarry ~AUD $30-50/tonne; often recoverable value from aggregate

excavation_method_factor.notes: Blasting is fastest but restricted in urban areas; rock breaker is universal

access_constraints.notes: Urban sites = reduced blasting hours, more vibration monitoring required

templates.name: Open Channel Drainage - Lined
templates.description: Open drainage channel, concrete lined, 100m base length, 1.5m width, urban stormwater

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Linear-based with cross-section (length × width × depth for volume; length for linear items)

channel_lining.lining_type: Concrete rigid (150mm thick minimum, N25 grade)
channel_lining.lining_rationale: Concrete prevents erosion, allows higher velocities, reduces maintenance

channel_excavation.detailed_calc: Channel trapezoid: 100m length × avg_width 3.1m × 0.8m depth = 248m³ (trapezoidal section)
channel_excavation.notes: 1:2 side slopes: base 1.5m + (2 × 0.8m slope) = 3.1m average width

concrete_lining.notes: 5% waste for overpour, surface finish irregularities, spillage

bedding_material.notes: 10% waste for compaction settlement, over-excavation tolerance

channel_excavation.notes: Rate includes grade setup and side slope cutting to 1:2

equipment_list: Concrete pump truck (or hand pour for small sections)
concrete_placement.notes: Concrete truck delivery included; typical slump 120-150mm for channel work

drainage_pipe_installation.pipe_placement: Under channel base for underdrain (perforated side down)
drainage_pipe_installation.notes: Allows subsurface drainage if channel constructed in permeable soil

gradient_factor.notes: Steeper gradients require stabilization (check dams, energy dissipation)

soil_type_factor.notes: Affects excavation stability and bedding preparation

access_factor.notes: Urban sites often have utilities along corridors; additional locating/protection needed

templates.name: Open Channel Drainage - Grass
templates.description: Open drainage channel, grassed swale, 100m base length, 2m width, low flow capacity

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Linear-based with cross-section (length × width × depth for volume)

channel_surface.grass_establishment: Kikuyu or similar native Australian pasture
channel_surface.soil_preparation: 400mm topsoil minimum for grass root establishment
channel_surface.maintenance_access: Side slopes 1:3 (allows mowing equipment to traverse)

channel_excavation.notes: 1:3 side slopes (gentler for grass safety): base 2.0m + (2 × 0.6m × 3) = 5.6m top

topsoil_placement.notes: 10% waste for compaction, settling, and segregation

turf_coverage.notes: 10% waste for seaming, edge trim, establishment losses

equipment_list: Grader for fine grading to design cross-section
channel_excavation.notes: Gentler 1:3 slopes = slower edge cutting than 1:2; more precision needed for grass stability

topsoil_spreading.gang_composition: 1 wheel loader operator + 1 laborer for raking
topsoil_spreading.notes: Topsoil dumped, spread, and lightly compacted

turf_laying.notes: Turf laid, pressed down, light watering; productivity assumes pre-prepared bed

gradient_factor.notes: Steeper gradients difficult for grass stability; may require reinforcement or conversion to lined channel

soil_quality_factor.notes: Poor soils require compost amendment for grass establishment

templates.name: Detention Basin - Small
templates.description: Small detention basin, 500m² surface area, 1.5m depth, outlet structure with orifice, 750m³ storage

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Area-based with depth for storage volume calculation

outlet_structure.outlet_type: Pit and orifice (gravity outlet, no pump)

basin_lining.maintenance: Annual mowing, sediment removal every 5 years

basin_excavation.notes: Irregular basins have smaller volume than rectangular; factor accounts for sloped edges

clay_liner_placement.formula: Basin surface area (base) + sloped side area × clay depth
clay_liner_placement.notes: 10% waste for compaction and over-excavation tolerance

topsoil_and_turf.notes: Turf and topsoil together ensure grass establishment and erosion control

basin_excavation.notes: Basin profiling requires precision to avoid sediment dead zones

equipment_list: Excavator with bucket for placing clay layers
clay_compaction.notes: Clay liner compacted in 250mm lifts for proper impermeability

outlet_structure_installation.notes: Pre-fabricated pit and orifice assembly; quick installation

soil_type_factor.notes: Clay basins naturally suited; sand requires imported clay liner (costly)

groundwater_factor.notes: High groundwater complicates construction and may require dewatering

templates.name: Detention Basin - Large
templates.description: Large detention basin, 2000m² surface area, 2.5m depth, outlet structure with bypass weir, 5000m³ storage

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Area-based with depth for storage volume calculation

outlet_structure.outlet_type: Pit, orifice plate, and emergency bypass weir

basin_construction.subgrade_preparation: Compacted clay or geotextile liner (if permeable soil)
basin_construction.embankment_construction: Earthen bund with crest width 2-3m for maintenance access

basin_excavation.notes: Larger basins benefit from better shape optimization (fewer side slopes relative to volume)

embankment_construction.notes: 5% waste for compaction settlement and over-fill to grade

clay_liner_or_geotextile.formula: Basin internal surface area × liner thickness
clay_liner_or_geotextile.lining_option_1: Clay liner: 735m³ compacted clay (if low-permeability soil on-site)
clay_liner_or_geotextile.notes: Design-dependent; clay preferred if available, geofabric if sandy site

equipment_list: Motor grader (for profiling and crest preparation)
basin_excavation.economy_of_scale: Larger basins achieve higher m³/day due to continuous equipment operation

outlet_structure_installation.notes: Large basin: more complex pit and weir assembly, longer concrete pour

project_scale_economy.notes: Larger basins achieve higher equipment utilization and faster m³/day

templates.name: Kerb & Gutter
templates.description: Standard kerb and gutter, 100m base length, extruded concrete profile, 150mm height, urban street

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Linear-based (length measurement, m; volume derived for concrete)

drainage_function.primary_function: Runoff capture and conveyance to stormwater inlet

installation_methodology.kerb_profile: Extruded precast concrete (straight runs) or custom cast (curves)
installation_methodology.jointing: Concrete or rubber joint sealant every 4-5m

kerb_linear_meters.notes: 3% waste for joint cuts, breakage during handling/placement

concrete_volume_kerb.calculation: 100m × (estimated 0.05m² per linear m) = 5m³ precast kerb concrete
concrete_volume_kerb.notes: Precast product; no waste applied (measured delivered)

sand_bed_material.notes: 10% waste for over-excavation, compaction settlement, segregation

equipment_list: Mini excavator or hand tools (for sand bed prep)
kerb_installation.notes: Assumes precast straight sections; custom curves slower (6 m/day)

sand_bed_preparation.notes: Sand bed must be compacted to 95% SD (standard) before kerb laying

joint_sealing.notes: Done after kerb cure (24hr); elastomeric sealant preferred (movement tolerance)

ground_condition_factor.notes: Poor ground requires extra sand bed thickness or ground stabilization

traffic_management_factor.notes: Busy streets require traffic control and work windows (night/weekend premium)

templates.name: Concrete Retaining Wall - Low
templates.description: Low-height concrete retaining wall (1.5m) - L-shaped gravity design, suitable for residential applications, no engineering certification required

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Height-based linear geometry (height × length, with volume derived for materials)

structural_classification.design_methodology: L-shaped gravity wall (no engineering required in most Australian states)
structural_classification.soil_assumptions: Class H (sandy clay) - moderate reactivity, passive pressure ~40 kN/m²

concrete_wall_volume.notes: 5% waste for spillage, over-pour, formwork overflow

concrete_footing_volume.notes: Combined wall + footing: 6.3 + 2.835 = 9.135m³ total concrete required

reinforcement_steel.notes: 8% waste for cut-offs, overlaps, site damage

formwork_assembly.notes: Straight wall = fast formwork; estimated 2.5 days setup

reinforcement_placement.notes: 920m rebar = 2.3 days; straight runs (no complex cages) = efficient

concrete_placement.gang_composition: 1 concrete pump operator + 2 finishing labourers + 1 supervisor
equipment_list: Concrete truck (pump truck or direct chute)
concrete_placement.notes: Small wall: can be poured in single day (morning); 24hr cure before backfill

formwork_removal.notes: Careful removal to avoid damage to fresh concrete

foundation_depth_factor.notes: Deeper foundations = more concrete, longer excavation

soil_bearing_factor.notes: Poor soils require larger footing or deeper embedment

specifications.reinforcement: N12 bars @ 300mm centres vertical and horizontal

project_context.typical_use: Residential garden terracing, driveway level changes
project_context.site_conditions: Level to moderate slope, good drainage
project_context.access: Standard residential access for concrete truck and excavator

assumptions: Wall height does not exceed 1.5m (no engineering certification required in most Australian states)
Level backfill (no surcharge loads)
Standard residential soil conditions (Class H)
No groundwater issues
Concrete truck access available within 30m
Standard 28-day concrete cure time
No special architectural finish required

templates.name: Concrete Retaining Wall - Medium
templates.description: Medium-height concrete retaining wall (3m) - Cantilever design with engineered footing, requires standard engineering certification

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Height-based linear geometry with cantilever analysis (height × length, volume derived)

structural_classification.design_methodology: Cantilever retaining wall (requires structural engineer certification)
structural_classification.soil_assumptions: Class H to M (sandy clay to clay) - moderate to high reactivity, passive pressure ~80 kN/m²
structural_classification.load_assumptions: Level backfill; no vehicle surcharge at crest

wall_design.foundation_length: Continuous pad footing (longer than low wall to resist overturning)
wall_design.reinforcement: N16 vertical @ 200mm, N12 horizontal @ 300mm (heavier than low wall)

concrete_footing_volume.notes: Much larger footing than low wall (resists 3m height overturning moment)

reinforcement_steel.vertical_calc: Vertical: 101 bars (1 per 200mm) × 3.2m = 323m of N16 = 2.42 kg/m × 323m = 782 kg
reinforcement_steel.horizontal_calc: Horizontal: 40 bars × 20m = 800m of N12 = 0.89 kg/m × 800m = 712 kg
reinforcement_steel.notes: Significant increase from low wall due to cantilever bending stresses

excavation_footing.notes: Deeper and wider excavation than low wall

equipment_list: Timber formwork (or steel formwork for reuse)
formwork_assembly.notes: Taller wall requires heavier bracing; 1.5x complexity of low wall

reinforcement_placement.notes: More complex lap joints and cage assembly than low wall

equipment_list: Concrete pump truck (longer reach for 3m height)
concrete_placement.notes: Larger pour; may split into 2 shifts to maintain quality control

height_factor.notes: Height drives footing size, reinforcement qty, and engineering complexity

soil_class_factor.notes: Soil class affects footing depth and passive pressure calculations

specifications.wall_system: Cantilever retaining wall with reinforced concrete footing
specifications.reinforcement: N16 bars @ 200mm centres vertical, N12 @ 300mm horizontal, starter bars L-bent
specifications.drainage: 150mm slotted drainage pipe with gravel backfill and geotextile wrap
specifications.soil_conditions: Class H to M (sandy clay to clay) - moderate to high reactivity
specifications.engineering_required: Standard structural engineering certification required (1.5-3.5m height range)

project_context.typical_use: Commercial property boundaries, multi-level residential terracing, basement walls
project_context.access: Good vehicular access for concrete trucks, excavators, and crane

assumptions: Wall height between 1.5m and 3.5m (standard engineering certification required)
Level backfill with no surcharge loads (vehicles/structures)
Standard soil conditions (Class H or M)
No groundwater within 1m of wall base
Concrete truck and crane access available
Engineering design provided (not included in rate)
Standard 28-day concrete cure time
Weather delays allowed in program
exclusions: Structural and civil engineering design fees
Council permits, DA approvals, and certification
Special architectural finishes or cladding systems

templates.name: Concrete Retaining Wall - High
templates.description: High-height concrete retaining wall (6m) - Anchored/tieback cantilever system, requires specialist engineering and construction methodology

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Height-based with complex geometry (height × length, volume for materials derived)

structural_classification.design_methodology: Anchored/tieback cantilever wall (specialist geotechnical + structural engineer required)
structural_classification.soil_assumptions: Class M to E (clay to highly reactive) - high to extreme reactivity, passive pressure ~160+ kN/m²
structural_classification.load_assumptions: Level backfill; no surcharge; anchors provide major portion of restraint

wall_design.footing_type: Reinforced concrete spread footing or piled foundation
wall_design.reinforcement: N20 bars @ 200mm c/c (vertical + horizontal), heavy mesh top/bottom

concrete_footing_volume.notes: Very large footing; may be piled in poor soil conditions

reinforcement_steel.wall_calc: Vertical: 151 bars (1 per 200mm) × 6.5m = 981m of N20 = 2.47 kg/m × 981m = 2,422 kg
reinforcement_steel.anchor_embedment: Starter bar embedment: 8 anchors × 3m = 24m of N25 = 3.86 kg/m × 24m = 93 kg
reinforcement_steel.notes: Massive increase from medium wall due to 6m height and anchor forces

ground_anchors.notes: Post-tensioned anchors: material + installation + testing ~AUD $2,000-3,000 per anchor

equipment_list: Heavy-duty steel formwork (reusable, for 6m height stability)
formwork_assembly.notes: Complex formwork; 2x complexity of medium wall. Precision critical for anchor embedment.

anchor_installation.gang_composition: 1 licensed drill rig operator + 1 geotechnical supervisor + 2 assistants
anchor_installation.testing_protocol: Load testing to 150% design load (ACI standard); pre-testing also
anchor_installation.notes: Anchor work done after wall pour; critical path item

equipment_list: Large concrete pump truck (or boom pump for height reach)
Multiple vibrators (for full consolidation in thick wall)
concrete_placement.notes: Large pour; may split across multiple days to manage concrete set and quality

height_and_complexity_factor.notes: Cost and time scale exponentially with height due to anchor system and engineering

anchor_feasibility_factor.notes: Anchor feasibility assessed by geotechnical engineer; poor strata = more anchors or deeper

specifications.wall_system: Anchored cantilever retaining wall with ground anchors or tiebacks
specifications.foundation_type: Reinforced concrete spread footing (2000mm x 1000mm) or piled foundation
specifications.concrete_grade: N50 (50 MPa) for wall, N40 for footing
specifications.reinforcement: N20 bars @ 200mm centres vertical and horizontal, heavy mesh top/bottom, anchor embedment zones
specifications.anchors: Post-tensioned ground anchors @ 2-3m centres, 10-15m length, 150-200kN capacity
specifications.drainage: 200mm slotted drainage pipe with gravel drainage layer, weepholes @ 2m centres
specifications.soil_conditions: Engineered design for site-specific soil (Class M to E) - high to extreme reactivity
specifications.engineering_required: Specialist structural and geotechnical engineering certification (>3.5m height)
specifications.finish: Form-finished concrete with architectural treatment or cladding system

project_context.typical_use: Major infrastructure, commercial developments, basement excavations, hillside developments
project_context.site_conditions: Steep slopes, complex site constraints, may include surcharge loads
project_context.access: Specialist equipment access required - piling rig, drilling rig, large crane, concrete pumps

assumptions: Wall height exceeds 3.5m (specialist engineering and certification required)
Ground anchor installation feasible (suitable founding strata available)
Site-specific geotechnical investigation completed
Specialist engineering design provided (not included)
No adjacent structures within zone of influence (or temporary support designed)
Anchor drilling and testing program included in methodology
Load testing of anchors to 150% design load
Extended construction program (12-16 weeks typical)
Quality assurance inspections by structural engineer
Concrete pump access available (restricted truck access)
exclusions: Site survey, geotechnical investigation, and soil testing
Structural, civil, and geotechnical engineering design fees
Council permits, DA approvals, CC certifications, and BCA compliance
Demolition, excavation support, and underpinning of adjacent structures
Temporary shoring, sheet piling, or soldier pile walls
Dewatering systems, groundwater monitoring, and environmental controls
Piling works if required for foundation support
Architectural cladding systems or facade treatments
Traffic management, road closures, and pedestrian controls

templates.name: Masonry Retaining Wall
templates.description: Medium-height masonry retaining wall (2m) - Mortared concrete block construction with reinforced concrete footing, standard engineering required

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Height-based linear geometry with block count derived (height × length, block volume)

structural_classification.design_methodology: Reinforced mortared concrete block wall (requires structural engineer)
structural_classification.soil_assumptions: Class H to M (sandy clay to clay) - moderate to high reactivity, passive pressure ~60 kN/m²

wall_design.vertical_reinforcement: N12 bars @ 400mm centres, grouted into cores
wall_design.horizontal_reinforcement: N12 bond beam every 4th course (~800mm vertical spacing)

block_quantity.notes: 7% waste for breakage, cut-in around pipes, delivery damage

mortar_requirement.notes: 15% waste for joint variations, over-fill, spillage

reinforcement_steel.notes: Much less steel than concrete wall (masonry provides some rigidity)

concrete_footing_volume.notes: Smaller footing than concrete wall (masonry lighter, blocks act as distributed load)

equipment_list: Scaffold or mobile elevated work platform
block_laying.notes: Australian productivity: 5.78-7.44 m²/day per person (Masonry Contractors Australia); 2 person = ~20 m²/day

grout_placement_in_cores.notes: Grouting done after block cure (24-48hr); critical for reinforcement bond

mortar_jointing.notes: Jointing (recess) for weathering; allows paint/render finish

block_size_factor.notes: Larger blocks = faster laying, fewer joints

specifications.wall_system: Reinforced mortared concrete block retaining wall
specifications.reinforcement: N12 vertical bars @ 400mm centres grouted into cores, N12 horizontal bond beam @ every 4th course
specifications.mortar: M3 mortar (cement:lime:sand 1:1:6) for general blockwork, M4 for bond beams
specifications.drainage: 100mm agricultural pipe with gravel backfill, weepholes @ 2m centres
specifications.soil_conditions: Class H to M (sandy clay to clay) - moderate to high reactivity
specifications.engineering_required: Standard structural engineering certification required (1.5-3.5m height range)
specifications.finish: Rendered and painted, or face block exposed finish

project_context.typical_use: Residential boundary walls, garden terracing, pool surrounds
project_context.site_conditions: Moderate slope, good drainage, stable founding layer
project_context.access: Standard residential access for concrete truck, block delivery, and excavator

assumptions: Wall height between 1.5m and 3.5m (standard engineering certification required)
Level backfill with no surcharge loads
Standard soil conditions (Class H or M)
No groundwater issues
Concrete truck access for footing pour
Block delivery and storage area available on site
Engineering design provided (not included in rate)
Weather protection during construction (mortar cure time)
Standard render finish (allowance included)
exclusions: Premium face block finishes or stone cladding
Special render systems or waterproofing membranes
Coping stones or capping systems (unless specified)

templates.name: Gabion Retaining Wall
templates.description: Medium-height gabion retaining wall (2.5m) - Rock-filled wire basket system with natural finish, standard engineering required

measurement_assumptions.sizing_method: Height-based linear geometry with stepped design (height × length, basket volumes derived)

design_methodology.design_system: Stepped gabion baskets (500mm height per step)
design_methodology.foundation: Compacted crushed rock base or shallow concrete footing

basket_specifications.per_linear_meter: 2 baskets per meter (500mm height) × 5 levels = 10 baskets/linear meter

basket_quantity.notes: 5% waste for damaged baskets in transit/installation

rock_fill_material.calculation: 200 baskets × 0.25m³ × 0.85 (accounting for voids in rock) = 42.5m³ rock
rock_fill_material.notes: 10% waste for oversizing, segregation, and spillage

foundation_preparation.notes: Rock base cheaper; concrete if poor soil conditions

geotextile_backing.notes: Geotextile separates gabion from backfill soil (prevents piping)

basket_assembly.notes: Baskets pre-assembled off-site if available; on-site assembly slower

equipment_list: Mini excavator or wheel loader (for rock placement)
Hand tools for compaction within basket
basket_placement_and_filling.notes: Baskets must be fully filled and tied before moving to next row (stability critical)

geotextile_installation.notes: Installed after wall complete; provides backfill separation

rock_availability_factor.notes: Rock cost scales with haul distance (transport dominate)

slope_stability_factor.notes: Steep sites require extra levelling and compaction

specifications.wall_system: Stepped gabion basket retaining wall (500mm stepped batter)
specifications.basket_type: 1000mm x 500mm x 500mm galvanized wire mesh gabion baskets (4mm wire, 80x100mm mesh)
specifications.foundation_type: Compacted crushed rock base (300mm depth) or shallow concrete footing
specifications.rock_fill: 150-300mm diameter rock (granite, basalt, or sandstone) - min 2.5 T/m³ density
specifications.drainage: Free-draining through gabion structure, 100mm slotted pipe behind wall with gravel
specifications.soil_conditions: Class H to M - suitable for moderate slopes and erosion control
specifications.engineering_required: Standard structural engineering certification required (1.5-3.5m height range)
specifications.finish: Natural rock face, no additional finish required

project_context.typical_use: Landscape features, creek bank stabilization, erosion control, commercial landscaping
project_context.site_conditions: Moderate slopes, areas requiring natural aesthetics and drainage
project_context.access: Truck access for rock delivery, excavator for placement

assumptions: Wall height between 1.5m and 3.5m (standard engineering certification required)
Stepped batter design (100mm step per 500mm basket height)
Level to moderate slope conditions
Rock fill material available locally (60km max haul distance)
Free-draining backfill (no fines or clay)
Basket assembly and rock filling by hand or excavator
Engineering design provided (not included in rate)
No special rock color or type specified (standard local rock)
Standard galvanized baskets (25+ year design life)
exclusions: Structural and civil engineering design fees
Erosion and sediment control during construction
Premium rock types (colored, imported, or specialty stone)
Planting pockets or vegetated gabion systems
